definition: to be on an equal footing
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Every man has felt himself to be the equal of a god at certain moments.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，每一个人都曾有过与神平起平坐的感觉。

sentences.english: I feel as if I am his equal now.
sentences.chinese: 我感到我现在可以和他平起平坐了”。

sentences.english: Maintain a buddy-buddy relationship with me and treat me as a complete equal.
sentences.chinese: 对我保持密友关系，以平起平坐的方式对待我。

sentences.english: Those children want to be level with adults.
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子要与大人们平起平坐。

to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
contend against

to be above/to place above

equally matched/about the same
to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete

deputy leader/the second-in-command
